entry.title: [GLOBAL][Baremetal] - Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer boot mode) removal
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 23, 09:00 - 13:00 UTC

Apr 17, 14:50 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Baremetal offer.

Start time : 23/06/2025 09:00 UTC
End time : 23/06/2025 13:00 UTC
Service impact : The Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer boot mode) will no longer be available after 23/06/2025.
Service improvement : The objective of this maintenance is to remove the Debian-10-based rescue system (rescue-customer boot mode) for all Baremetal products.
Customers should start using the new Debian-12-based rescue system (rescue12-customer).

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Bare Metal Cloud] - End Of Life personal template
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 17, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

May 19, 15:40 UTC
Update - As part of our continuous improvement plan, change is scheduled on our API.

⚠ API change

We are announcing the End of Life (EoL) for the personal OS installation templates feature on our dedicated servers.

On June 17, 2025, the first phase of the personal OS installation template decommissioning will begin. Customers will no longer be able to create new personal OS installation templates or modify existing ones. However, they will still be able to use their existing personal templates for OS installations.
Affected customers have received an email with specific information about migrating to the new API call. More details.

Concretely, the following API calls will be definitely removed:
POST /me/installationTemplate
PUT /me/installationTemplate/{templateName}
POST /me/installationTemplate/{templateName}/checkIntegrity
POST /me/installationTemplate/{templateName}/partitionScheme
PUT /me/installationTemplate/{templateName}/partitionScheme/{schemeName}
POST /me/installationTemplate/{templateName}/partitionScheme/{schemeName}/hardwareRaid
PUT /me/installationTemplate/{templateName}/partitionScheme/{schemeName}/hardwareRaid/{name}
POST /me/installationTemplate/{templateName}/partitionScheme/{schemeName}/partition
PUT /me/installationTemplate/{templateName}/partitionScheme/{schemeName}/partition/{mountpoint}

If you are using the OVHcloud Control Panel, you can still save your installation parameters without the need for programming skills thanks to our easy-to-use interface.

Start time: 17/06/2025 08:30 UTC
End time: 17/06/2025 08:45 UTC
Service impact: None
Service improvement : We are enhancing our OS installation service by transitioning to a more robust and flexible API-based approach. This evolution will provide you with improved reliability and more advanced options for your server deployments.

May 13, 21:20 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Bare Metal Cloud offer.

entry.title: [GRA1][Dedicated Servers] - rack G126B19 incident notification.
entry.content:
Jun 16, 09:53 UTC
Resolved - We would like to inform you that an incident happened on our Dedicated Servers offering, on rack G126B19 in GRA1 and it has now been resolved.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 16/06/2025 11:15 UTC
End time : 16/06/2025 11:23 UTC
Service impact : Public Network was unreachable on this rack
Customer impact : Customers could not acces their services when they wanted to use the Public Network.
Root Cause : https://network.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/6gr71jrt0kny

We thank you for your understanding and patience throughout this incident.
